Description: Bronze wig-curler in the form of a horse and rider.
Curator's comments: Published: Schulman, A. R. (1957). Egyptian Representations of Horsemen and Riding in the New Kingdom. Journal of Near Eastern Studies, 16(4), p.265-6 Leclant, Asarte a cheval d'apres les representations egyptiennes in Syria XXXVII (1960), p.1-76, see p.37-8, Fig.15, p.37 note 9. Janssen and Janssen, Egyptian Household Animals, (1989), p.40, Fig.32.
Bibliographic references: Curtis & Tallis 2012 / The Horse from Arabia to Ascot (11)
Exhibition history: Exhibited: 2012 24 May-30 Sep, London, BM 'The horse:from Arabia to Royal Ascot' 1983-1984 May-Feb, London, Imperial War Museum, 'Animals in War'
